thread.title: High schools: Outside the Box, Oct. 1
thread.title_full: High schools: Outside the Box, Oct. 1 - San Antonio Express-News

author: David Hinojosa and Terrence Thomas
title: High schools: Outside the Box, Oct. 1
text:
Photo: Ashley Landis /For The Express-News Image 1 of / 3 Caption
Close
Image 1 of 3 Poth celebrates a 3-0 win over Brock during their UIL Class 3A state championship volleyball match on Nov. 22, 2014 at the Cullwell Center in Garland.
Photo: Ashley Landis /For The Express-News Poth celebrates a 3-0 win over Brock during their UIL Class 3A... Image 2 of 3 Abby Buckingham of the Churchill Chargers blows a ball by Lauren Schilling (18) and Faith Squier of Reagan at Littleton Gym on Sept. 22, 2015 in a battle of top-rated volleyball teams.
Photo: Tom Reel /San Antonio Express-News Abby Buckingham of the Churchill Chargers blows a ball by Lauren... Image 3 of 3 New Braunfels Canyon’s Sam Worley (from right) runs ahead of Holmes’ Chris Myers and Brandeis’ Beau Anderson during Judson’s Ron Faught Invitational at Rutledge Stadium on March 21, 2015. Worley won the event with a time of 4 minutes, 21.28 seconds.
Photo: Marvin Pfeiffer /San Antonio Express-News New Braunfels Canyon’s Sam Worley (from right) runs ahead of... High schools: Outside the Box, Oct. 1 1 / 3 Back to Gallery From inside the lines to out, Express-News staff writers David Hinojosa and Terrence Thomas take a look back and a look ahead at the high school sports landscape:
Figure this
4: District volleyball losses for Poth since October 2002, including Tuesday’s 25-20, 25-13, 25-16 setback to Goliad. The Pirettes are 129-4 in district during that span.
2,102: Kills that MacArthur junior outside hitters Mallory Potts and Madison Trawick have combined for during their two-plus varsity seasons with the Brahmas.
Potts has 1,280 kills, including 517 this year, and has reached the 500-kill plateau for the second straight season. Trawick has 822 kills, including 436 this year.
Odds and ends
Volleyball: Churchill senior outside hitter Abby Buckingham was scheduled to have surgery on Thursday to repair her left ACL, according to her Twitter account.
The 6-foot-1 Buckingham, a Texas commit, suffered the injury on the final point of the Chargers’ District 26-6A match against rival Reagan on Sept. 22. She injured the same knee in February 2014 while playing in a club tournament.
Cross country: Many of the state’s top runners will participate in Saturday’s Round Rock Invitational at Old Settlers Park, the site of next month’s UIL state championships.
The meet will be a big test for several area runners, including New Braunfels senior Paige Hofstad and New Braunfels Canyon junior Sam Worley , who are entered in the Gold Division. Hofstad and Worley won last week’s regional meet preview in Corpus Christi.
Smithson Valley’s girls, who breezed to a win in Corpus Christi, should be in the mix in the team standings.
